item.title: Git Notes
item.description: Git Branches How Git Stores Data (briefly) Git stores data as a series of snapshots. When you make a commit, git creates a commit object which contains: a pointer to the snapshot of the content you staged a pointer to any previous commit/commits the name and email of who made the commit This commit object will not point directly to the snapshots of the staged contents.
